com.tversity.sdk.android
Interface IAirFlinger

public interface IAirFlinger

This interface provides the main SDK functionality

Using this interface you should initialize and terminate the SDK and get access to available devices

Method Summary

Method Detail

init

void init(Activity activity,
          int listenerPort,
          AirFlinger.IEventCallback eventCallback,
          int eventMask,
          AirFlinger.ILogCallback logCallback)
          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Use this method first before trying to access any of AirFlinger's functionality.

Parameters:
activity - The activity that hosts AirFlinger
listenerPort -
eventCallback - Callback to receive notifications
eventMask - Bitwise combination of AirFlinger.EVENT_LISTEN_* that specifies to which SDK events to listen
logCallback - Optional callback to receive all SDK's log messages
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

terminate

void terminate(boolean shutdownService)
               throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Cleanup method - terminates the SDK actions.

Parameters:
shutdownService - If true, will shutdown the AirFlinger service. If false, will only disconnect the application from the service, but will keep the service active
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

setLogCallback

void setLogCallback(AirFlinger.ILogCallback logCallback)
                    throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Sets a callback to receive all SDK's log messages.

Note: To disconnect an active log callback, set logCallback to null

Parameters:
logCallback - Callback to receive all SDK's log messages
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

log

void log(int logLevel,
         java.lang.String tag,
         java.lang.String message)
Logs a message.

Parameters:
logLevel - Severity level of the log message. Use any of the AirFlinger.LOG_* values
tag - The tag under which the message will be logged
message - The message to log

searchDevices

void searchDevices()
                   throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Searches for devices on the network.

Note: New devices found by this command, will be reported through the AirFlinger events callback

Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

lockWifiForMulticast

void lockWifiForMulticast(boolean lockWifi)
                          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Locks the device's WiFi to accept multicast transmissions.

Note: It is advised to lock the WiFi for multicast and request a searchDevices command when opening a device selection screen, and to release the WiFi multicast lock when leaving the device selection screen. This practice will enable new devices to be added to the list even after the user opens the selection screen. Releasing the lock is intended to save battery power.

Parameters:
lockWifi - Specifies whether to lock or release the multicast lock
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

getCurrentDevices

IAFDevice[] getCurrentDevices()
Gets a list of all discovered devices.

This function returns a snapshot of the known devices that were discovered at the time of the call.

Note: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Returns:
An array of all the devices that AirFlinger detected.

getCurrentDevices

IAFDevice[] getCurrentDevices(AirFlinger.DeviceType deviceType)
Gets a list of all discovered devices of the specified type.

This function returns a snapshot of the known devices of the specified type that were discovered at the time of the call.

Note: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Parameters:
deviceType - Type of the devices to receive
Returns:
An array of all the devices of the specified type that AirFlinger detected.

getCurrentPlayers

IAFPlayer[] getCurrentPlayers()
Gets a list of all discovered players.

This is a convenience method which is the same as calling getCurrentDevices(DeviceType.PLAYER) with the returned list already casted to IAFPlayer.

Note 1: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Note 2: IEventCallback.OnPlayerStatusChange() callback should be used to monitor changes to this list.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Returns:
An array of all the players that AirFlinger detected.

getCurrentServers

IAFServer[] getCurrentServers()
Gets a list of all discovered servers.

This is a convenience method which is the same as calling getCurrentDevices(DeviceType.SERVER) with the returned list already casted to IAFServer.

Note 1: Device discovery can take some time, so if the function is called right after starting the AirFlinger service, the list may be partial.
Note 2: IEventCallback.OnServerStatusChange() callback should be used to monitor changes to this list.
Important: once a device is added to the list, it is never removed. Namely, it can turn offline if disconnected or shutdown and then online again.

Returns:
An array of all the servers that AirFlinger detected.

getPlayer

IAFPlayer getPlayer(java.lang.String deviceId)
                    throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Gets a specific player device by its id.

Parameters:
deviceId - The id of the player to get
Returns:
The requested player
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

IAFServer getServer(java.lang.String deviceId)
                    throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
Gets a specific server device by its id.

Parameters:

Returns:
The requested server
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

getLocalMedia

IAFMediaBrowse getLocalMedia(IAFMediaClasses.EntryType type,
                             boolean bypassSingleChildFolders)
Gets a media browser object containing all local media items of the requested type.

Parameters:
type - The type of the media items to browse
bypassSingleChildFolders - If sets to true, the media browser will automatically drill down directories that contain only one sub-directory with no media items
Returns:
A media browser object
See Also:
IAFMediaBrowse
